Job Title: VP Relationship Manager Franchise Finance

Location: California, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
About The Organization

SMBC MANUBANK was formed by a group of banking entrepreneurs in June 1962. Our scope is to serve the specialized needs of California middle-market businesses, manufacturers, wholesalers, distributors, importers, exporters, and service companies, including small businesses and professionals.

Our mission is to be "the bank of choice" for middle market and professional service companies by establishing long term customer relationships and loyalty, providing superior products and services through a core of highly skilled and seasoned bankers.

To achieve our mission to be the 'bank of choice' for middle market and professional services companies, we are focused on our vision to be the premier California regional business bank that can provide the sophistication and expertise of a larger institution with the personal 'high touch' services of a smaller bank.

Specialties

Commercial Loans and Lines of Credit, Asset-Based Financing, SBA Loans, and Specialized Financing, Real Estate Loans, Cash Management Services, International Services

Job Summary

As a Relationship Manager in the Franchise Finance lending vertical of the bank, the RM will source and build a franchise portfolio comprising of top tier Quick Service Restaurant (QSR) brands. Key responsibilities include serving as the primary point of contact or trusted advisor and acquiring, deepening, and maintaining profitable relationships, including cross selling ancillary products to clients. collaborating with teammates and facilitating client relationships with Product Specialists

Principal Duties And Responsibilities

Independently source and manage QSR transactions in top tier brands with annual revenues of $20MM to $500MM in revenues. Manages a portfolio of existing franchisee accounts comprised of small, medium, and large transactions including syndicated deals. Acquires, deepens, and maintains profitable client relationships through sales, prospecting, and enhancing existing relationships through cross-sell.Understands and interprets financial and cash flow statements to assess and analyze financial conditions of companies and industry trends.Collaborates with Portfolio Managers and analysts in structure transactions that fits within the Bank’s credit appetite. Collaborates with Product partners in credit, deposits and treasury management to design and deliver a holistic solution to the client. Pre-screen new deals and add-on requests with Credit Administration and present transactions to the Bank’s Capital Allocation Committee to secure credit approval. Review and negotiate loan documents with clients/prospects and secure needed approval from Credit Administration as needed.Monitor the portfolio closely and identify any weakness in credits and take appropriate credit action to adjust risk rating and develop an exit strategy.Assist PM/analysts in keeping portfolio ticklers current. Coaches and mentors peers as needed.Adapts to changes in sales practices and broader market and industry conditions as needed.Regular in-person meetings with clients and prospects, and attending trade shows and lender meetings. 

POSITION SPECIFICATIONS

Must have a minimum of 7-10 years of experience in Commercial Lending with a focus in Franchise lending. Strong knowledge of the various QSR/Fast Food brands and familiarity with underwriting guidelines to this specialized cash flow lending verticalDemonstrates ability to successfully manage an extensive portfolio of clients. Proven track record of prospecting new business, enhancing existing relationships and closing profitable transactions. Professional proven sales skills and experience, including planning, execution and follow-up of client meetings. Financial modeling experience and the completion of formal credit training is required. Outstanding oral and written communication skills. 

EOE STATEMENT

We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

CCPA DISCLOSURE

Personal Information Collection Notice: This notice contains information under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) about the categories of personal information (PI) of California residents that SMBC MANUBANK collects and the business or commercial purpose(s) for which the PI may be used. We do not sell PI. More information about our collection and use of PI may be found in our CCPA Privacy Policy at https://www.manufacturersbank.com/CCPA-Privacy. Persons with disabilities may contact our Customer Contact Center toll-free at (877) 560-9812 to request the information in this Notice in an alternative format.

Experience Level (if available): None
